bug.short_desc: Eudora won't open because it states that Thunderbird is already open

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X 10.5; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 Build Identifier: EudoraOSE/1
I run Eudroa OSE from an external drive on 3 different computers. Two are G5 desktops and one is a Powerbook Pro (all running OSX 10.5). It has been working well on all three but now every time I try to open it on one of the G5 computers it opens the icon in the dock and then a message appears to say that it can't open Eudora because it can't open more than one copy of Thunderbird. It is working normally on the other 2 computers. I have tried restarting the computer several times to no avail. I removed the 'plist' file in the preferences folder in the library and that didn't fix it either.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Double click on Eudora icon 2. Eudora icon appears in the dock 3. Message appears 'Close Thunderbird. A copy of Thunderbird is already open. Only one copy of Thunderbird can be open at a time.' 4. Close this dialog box and Eudora icon disappears from dock Actual Results: As above
Expected Results: Opened Eudora and my mailboxes
